question_text: Assuming the material considered in each statement is homogeneous, isotropic, linear  elastic, and the deformations are in the elastic range, which one or more of the  following statement(s) is/are TRUE?
option1: A body subjected to hydrostatic pressure has no shear stress.
option2: If a long solid steel rod is subjected to tensile load, then its volume increases.
option3: Maximum shear stress theory is suitable for failure analysis of brittle materials.
option4: If a portion of a beam has zero shear force, then the corresponding portion of the  elastic curve of the beam is always straight.
